alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester; Mercer; Northwestern Burlington; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern New Castle, northern Salem, northwestern Camden, western Mercer, Gloucester, northwestern Burlington, southeastern Montgomery, southeastern Bucks, Philadelphia and Delaware Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ivyland to Wilmington Manor. Movement was east at 45 mph. Some of the stronger storms are producing small hail. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Trenton, Camden, Wilmington, Gloucester City, Cherry Hill, Bensalem, Mount Laurel, Ewing, Norristown, Chester, Willingboro, Deptford, West Deptford, Glassboro, Lindenwold, East Norriton, Pennsville, Princeton and Bellmawr. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 4. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 330 and 359. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 23. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 40. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 7 and 23. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 330 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 41, and between mile markers 68 and 76. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 19. Atlantic City Expressway near mile marker 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with some of the storms along the line. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern, central and northwestern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern Delaware...and southern New Jersey.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Gloucester; Mercer; Northwestern Burlington; Salem
